ca.mcgill.ecse211.t14

Class SearchAndRescue

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.t14.SearchAndRescue

  • public class SearchAndRescue
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides methods to search and rescue the stranded vehicle and provides methods to avoid obstacles.
    Author:
    ANDREW TA, SEAN TAN

    • Method Detail

      • searchForTheCart

        public static boolean searchForTheCart()
        This method locates the stranded vehicle within the search zone. Upon entering the search zone, the robot will use the provided search zone coordinates and UltrasonicWatcher to orient itself perpendicular to the left wall of the search zone. Using LineWatcher, the robot will orient itself along a grid line. The robot will then perform a sweep from that grid line toward the right direction, simultaneously polling distances. A variable OBJECT_DETECTION_THRESHOLD is set to a distance of 10 cm. In the case that a polled distance falls below this 10 cm threshold, a boolean variable objectDetected indicates that an object has been detected. The robot then navigates such that it is a distance of 10 cm from the detected object. A variable CART_DETECTION_ANGLE set to 60ยบ is used to distinguish the stranded cart from other detected objects. Using UltrasonicWatcher the robot performs a sweep of the detected object. A variable OBJECT_ANGLEis calculated based on the rising/falling edges of when the ultrasonic sensor detects an object and when it does not. If the computed OBJECT_ANGLE is within 3ยบ of the set CART_DETECTION_ANGLE, then the method confirms that the detected object is the stranded vehicle.
        Returns:
        true if the stranded vehicle is located successfully; false otherwise.

      • locateAttachmentPoint

        public static void locateAttachmentPoint()
        This method locates the point of attachment that will be used by the robot to secure the stranded vehicle for towing. Using the light sensor and ColourArbiter, the robot scans the detected vehicle until it identifies the Colour associated with the attachment point. Assume that the attachment point has a colour associated with it in the form of coloured electrical tape.

      • rescueTheCart

        public static void rescueTheCart()
        aligns the robot to correct angles and position before pulling the cart inside

      • detectObstacle

        public static boolean detectObstacle()
        does the us scanning to look for any obstacles
        Returns:
        a boolean set to true if an obstacle is detected

      • avoidObstacle

        public static void avoidObstacle()
        move away from the obstacles if any is detected
